item.latestTitle: Pandemic and All-Hazards Preparedness and Advancing Innovation Act of 2018

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 117 (Thursday, July 12, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BILIRAKIS:H.R. 6357.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:This bill is enacted pursuant to Article I, Section 8,Clause 18 of the Constitution of the United States.[Page H6175]

item.title: To direct the Comptroller General of the United States to assess and make recommendations related to disaster medical assistance teams, and for other purposes.
To direct the Comptroller General of the United States to assess and make recommendations related to disaster medical assistance teams, and for other purposes.

bill.title: To direct the Comptroller General of the United States to assess and make recommendations related to disaster medical assistance teams, and for other purposes.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.text: This bill requires the Government Accountability Office to assess the readiness of disaster medical assistance teams to respond to current and emerging natural and manmade threats.
item.name: Introduced in House

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
